text: George Sutton (1 October 1887 - 16 January 1949) was an English cricketer. He was a right-handed batsman who played for Essex. He was born in West Ham and died in Penge. Sutton made one first-class appearance for Essex, against Yorkshire during the 1912 season - though he was removed for a duck - in the middle of an Alonzo Drake hat-trick. Sutton was a tailend batsman. ==External links== *George Sutton at Cricket Archive Category:1887 births Category:1949 deaths Category:English cricketers Category:Essex cricketers Category:People from West Ham
title: George Sutton (cricketer)
